release.action: Corrected bug 1688910 -- Characterisation rules not implemented correctly
Corrected bug 1609808 -- Ids become inconsistent if an expr is typechecked twice
Corrected bug 1606459 -- Ids in set comprehension
Corrected bug 1578608 -- Using a given type as a generic doesn't work
Corrected bug 1497266 -- Typechecker merges too many DeclName ids.
Corrected bug 1486054 -- Stack overflow. Also, corrected problem with type inference in the example specification provided with that bug report.
Restrict class types to trees and not graphs to prevent stack overflowing when printing ASTs (bug 1448515).
Fixed problem with renaming in mutually recursive types.
Corrected bug number 1443880 -- Duplicate names not allowed in unrelated sections.
Expanded schema references beginning Delta and Xi when they are locally declared. Added new class AbstractTypeEnv, superclass to SectTypeEnv and TypeEnv, which provides the method to do this.
Only the left side of freetypes are in scope for mutually recursive free types.
Use the ZDeclName ID attribute to distinguish between the same names in different scopes.
Fixed a problem with calculating the characteristic tuple in SetCompExprs, LambdaExprs, and MuExprs.
Fixed a problem with class type unification to improve type inferencing.
Implement a check that generic classes with an empty signature cannot be class unioned with two different sets of parameters, e.g. G[\nat] \classunin G[\power\nat].
Implemented implicit downcasting (e.g. a \in B => p)
Improved the error messages reported for relation applications.
Instantiate and check that generic types are instantiated for selection expressions that reference a generic definition in a class.
Add recursive operation definitions within the same class paragraph.
Finish type rules for PolyExpr (check that sublasses have the type-compatible features).
Added a method "override" to TypeEnv that is used in downcasting objects, so that downcasting in a scope enrichment is visible to the right-hand-side of the scope enrichment.
Primary variable names declared in a superclass can now be used in delta lists.
Rename primary variable names in rename exprs.
Add functionality to check clashing inherited features.
Add the "self" variable to a class state.
Changed the type rule for containment exprs to allow any class expression after discussions with Graeme.
Allow type-compatible overriding of attributes and state variables.
Overridden operations have access to the declarations in the definition in the superclass.
No "Init" definition in a class implies init = true. This allows "Init" to be selected even if not declared.
Prevent calls on recursive types in renameUnknownTypes()
Implemented a check that names in the visibility list are features of the class.
Changed the Object-Z typechecker so that only class names can be inherited, not just arbitrary classes of type ClassRefType.
If the signature of an operation cannot be determined due to a recursive defition, the signature should be empty instead of raising an error.
Improved error message for incompatible Object-Z operation inheritance by specifying the inheritance expression.
Addition of \oid to the Object-Z typing environment.
Conjunction operations and scope enrichments operators both allow downcasting within larger operation expressions.
Improved the weak typing unification algorithm to better infer variable types.
Initial Release.

actions.action: Implement functionality to allow downcasting using selections as well as names (e.g obj.val \in C)
Specify the Object-Z type rules using the type-inference rule metalanguage defined in the Z standard.
Look at ways to infer class types using attribute and operation selection expressions.
Modify unification algorithm to prevent PredExprs being used as sets.
